raw_text:
Klinsmann issues Lehmann warning
 
 Germany coach Jurgen Klinsmann has warned goalkeeper Jens Lehmann he may have to quit Arsenal to keep his World Cup dreams alive.
 
 Lehmann is understudy to Oliver Kahn in the German squad, but has lost his place to Manuel Alumnia at Highbury. Klinsmann said: "It will be difficult for any of our players if he is not a first-choice at his club. "If Jens is not Arsenal's number one keeper, that is a problem for me. He must be playing regularly." Lehmann is desperate to keep his place in the Germany squad when the country hosts the World Cup in 2006. Klinsmann added: "If he is not playing regularly he cannot be Germany's number one keeper, or even number two keeper. "The situation for Jens is that he is currently the number two keeper at Arsenal. This could be critical if it remains the same during next season."
llama3.2:1b: Klinsmann warns Lehmann to keep playing for Germany, but says not being first-choice keeper at Arsenal would be a problem for him.
llama3.2:3b: Jurgen Klinsmann warned Jens Lehmann that he may have to quit Arsenal to maintain his spot in the German World Cup squad, as regular playing time is crucial for a goalkeeper's position in the team.
gemma2:2b: Klinsmann warns Lehmann he may need to leave Arsenal to play in the 2006 World Cup with Germany, due to his current lack of playing time.
He stressed that regular first-choice status is crucial for Lehmann's hopes of being Germany's number one goalkeeper.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Jens Lehmann of German club Arsenal might have to quit the tournament in order to keep his world championship dream alive, according to head coach Jurgen Klinsmann.
Klinsmann has warned that if Lehmann is not a first-choice goalkeeper at Arsenal, he must be playing regularly or may have to drop out altogether.
He also emphasized that if Lehmann is not playing for Arsenal again next season, he might not be the number one or even two keeper for Germany in the tournament.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Klinsmann warns Lehmann to quit Arsenal for World Cup qualification.
qwen2.5:3b: Germany coach Jurgen Klinsmann has warned goalkeeper Jens Lehmann he may have to quit Arsenal to keep his World Cup dreams alive.
As Lehmann is only understudy in Germany's squad and struggling for playing time, Klinsmann stated that if Lehmann isn't Arsenal's number one keeper, it will be a problem for him.
Lehmann needs regular playing time to maintain his place in the German national team, currently ranked as second-choice goalkeeper at Arsenal.

Klinsmann issues Lehmann warning

Germany coach Jurgen Klinsmann has warned goalkeeper Jens Lehmann he may have to quit Arsenal to keep his World Cup dreams alive.
Lehmann is understudy to Oliver Kahn in the German squad, but has lost his place to Manuel Alumnia at Highbury.
Klinsmann said: "It will be difficult for any of our players if he is not a first-choice at his club.
"If Jens is not Arsenal's number one keeper, that is a problem for me.
Lehmann is desperate to keep his place in the Germany squad when the country hosts the World Cup in 2006.
Klinsmann added: "If he is not playing regularly he cannot be Germany's number one keeper, or even number two keeper.
"The situation for Jens is that he is currently the number two keeper at Arsenal.
This could be critical if it remains the same during next season.
smollm:1.7b: Klinsmann issues a warning to Lehmann, advising him to stay away from Oliver Kahn in the German squad and not to lose his place as goalkeeper.
He also warns that if Jens is not Arsenal's number one keeper, he will have difficulty playing at his club.
Klinsmann added that if Jens is not Arsenal's number two keeper, it could be a problem for him.
The situation for Jens Lehmann is that he is currently the number two keeper at Arsenal and this could be critical if it remains the same during next season.
deepseek-r1:1.5b: Klinsmann has warned Lehmann that he might have to leave Arsenal to keep his chances of winning the World Cup alive.
Lehmann is currently second at Arsenal but lost his spot to Alumnia at Highbury.
Klinsmann emphasized that if anyone isn't a first-choice player, it could affect the coach's priorities.
Jens Lehmann is number two at Arsenal, and his current role might make him crucial for the coach during the next season.
tinyllama:1.1b: Klinsmann warns goalkeeper Jen Lehmann of a possible exit to avoid his World Cup dreams being jeopardized due to understuffing with Manuel Alumnia at Arsenal's Highbury.
Klinsmann stated that if the player is not Arsenal's first-choice keepers, it will be difficult for him to remain in the German squad in 2006 and beyond.
Despite his current role as backup goalkeeper, Lehmann is struggling for playing time at Arsenal due to Alumnia's continuous presence.
Klinsmann believes that if he remains the understuffed number two keeper, this could potentially harm Lehmann's chances of being Germany's No.
2 keeper during the World Cup in 2006.
tinydolphin:1.1b: German coach Jurgen Klinsmann has warned goalkeeper Jens Lehmann that he may need to find a new club to keep his World Cup dream alive.
According to the German FA (DFB), Klinsmann has expressed concerns over Lehmann's current position as Arsenal's backup goaltender, with Manuel Alumnia now being favored for the job.
If Lehmann isn't playing regularly, he could potentially be considered an unfit player and not fit to represent Germany in the upcoming World Cup.

This issue is a significant concern for Klinsmann who has stated that if this situation doesn't change by the time Germany hosts the tournament in 2006, they may need to consider finding a new goalkeeper to suit their needs.

If Lehmann is not playing regularly, it will be difficult for him to be Germany's number one keeper or even number two keeper.

If Lehmann is not a first-choice at his club, it's a problem for me.

hermes3:3b: Klinsmann warns Lehmann: If Germans' #1 keeper not regular club player, World Cup hopes may fade.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: Klinsmann warns Lehmann of potential exile from Arsenal to secure World Cup spot.
Lehmann, second goalkeeper in German squad, faces being replaced by Manuel Alumnia.
Klinsmann stipulates that a first-team spot is crucial for players competing in the World Cup, and warns that consistent playing time at Arsenal is necessary for success on international stage.
chatgpt-4o-latest: Germany coach Jurgen Klinsmann has warned goalkeeper Jens Lehmann that he may need to leave Arsenal to secure his place in the national squad for the 2006 World Cup.
Lehmann, currently Germany's second-choice keeper behind Oliver Kahn, has lost his starting position at Arsenal to Manuel Almunia.

Klinsmann emphasized that regular club play is essential for national team selection, stating that if Lehmann remains a backup at Arsenal, his position as Germany's number two—or even his place in the squad—could be at risk.
stablelm2:1.6b: Germany coach Jurgen Klinsmann has cautioned goalkeeper Jens Lehmann to stay with Arsenal if he wants to maintain his World Cup hopes.
Lehmann, who plays second fiddle to Oliver Kahn in Germany's squad, has lost his position to Manuel Alumnia at Highbury.
Klinsmann says it'll be challenging for any of the players if they're not the first-choice at their clubs.
If Lehmann isn S't Arsenal's top keeper, a problem arises; he must play regularly.
Lehmann dreams of remaining in Germany's World Cup squad when the country hosts the tournament next year.
If he doesn't play frequently enough, it could jeopardize his position as the second-choice keeper at Arsenal.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Germany national team coach Jurgen Klinsmann has cautioned goalkeeper Jens Lehmann, who is currently on Arsenal's bench, about the potential impact of not being a first-choice player at his club.
Klinsmann emphasized that regular playing time is crucial for Lehmann to maintain his position in the Germany squad for the 2006 World Cup.
As Manuel Almunia has taken over as Arsenal's starter, Klinsmann views this as a significant concern and warns that Lehmann must consistently play regularly to retain his international standing.
